text: My 4-year-old self received a letter from Mike Ilitch Free Press sports writer Anthony Fenech on the letter he wrote to Mike Ilitch and the reply he received Post to Facebook My 4-year-old self received a letter from Mike Ilitch Free Press sports writer Anthony Fenech on the letter he wrote to Mike Ilitch and the reply he received  //on.freep.com/2ky5Ojs   Join the Conversation   My 4-year-old self received a letter from Mike Ilitch Anthony Fenech   11:29   Facebook A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Buy Photo Mike and Marian Ilitch hoist the Stanley Cup on June 16, 1998 in Washington, D.C. after the Red Wings won their second consecutive NHL title by sweeping the Capitals. Vyacheslav Kozlov is at left. Julian H. Gonzalez, DFP Fullscreen Buy Photo Mike Ilitch is remembered on the marquee of the Fox Theater on Friday, Feb. 10, 2017 in downtown Detroit. Elaine Cromie  Mike Ilitch holds up his new uniform when he took the field as Tiger Stadium as the team's new owner. Fred Press archives The Mike Ilitch family after the purchase of the Detroit Red Wings in June of 1982. PATRICIA BECK  Detroit Tigers owners Mike and Marian Ilitch take the field at Tiger Stadium. Free Press archives Fullscreen Buy Photo Mike Ilitch, owner of the Fox Theater, is photographed in the lobby of the Fox on July 9, 1987. JOHN COLLIER  Fullscreen Buy Photo In Nov. 2003, Detroit Red Wings owner Mike Ilitch shows off his Hockey Hall of Fame ring in the Great Hall with the original Stanley Cup in the background in Toronto. Kirthmon F Dozier  Fullscreen Buy Photo In 2003, Mike Ilitch took photos with his wife Marian and the family after he was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in Toronto. Kirthmon F Dozier  Detroit Red Wings and Detroit Tigers owner Mike Ilitch smiles with his wife Marian, during induction ceremonies for the Michigan Sports Hall of Fame in Detroit, Tuesday, March 30, 2004. PAUL SANCYA, AP THE FIRST LITTLE CAESARS STORE Mike and Marian Ilitch invested their $10,000 life savings to open the first Little Caesars store in Garden City in 1959. Little Caesars Little Caesar's owner Mike Ilitch with trophies won by teams he sponsors circa 1976. Little Caesars Mike Ilitch in uniform as a player for the Marines' team from Quantico, VA. Ilitch also played for the Tigers' farm system in the 1950s. Handout Fullscreen Buy Photo In 1977, Mike Ilitch, whose Caesars professional softball team doesn't figure to make money this year, but which Ilitch insists can be a paying proposition in the future. SCOTT ECCKER  In 1980, Little Caesars Mike Ilitch is photographed with his pizza. RICHARD LEE  Detroit Red Wings new owner Mike Ilitch is presented a team jacket rom former owner Bruce Norris. Ilitch bought the team from Norris in 1982. Handout A young Steve Yzerman and Wings owner Mike Ilitch shake hands in a 1983 photo from Yzerman's rookie year with the Red Wings. Courtesy Detroit Red Wings Mike Ilitch at Joe Louis Arena in 1992. Detroit Free Press Fullscreen Buy Photo MARIAN AND MIKE ILITCH, owners of Little Caesars izza restaurants, sample the main dish at the opening of their 1,000th store Tuesday in Bloomfield Township in March of 1986.. WILLIAM ARCHIE  Fullscreen Buy Photo In 1985, Detroit Mayor Coleman Young eats a slice of pizza at a fundraiser for the hungry in Detroit. It was sponsored by Little Caesars Pizza, owned by Mike Ilitch. Detroit Free Press Fullscreen Buy Photo Marian and Mike Ilitch are entertained by Stan Baker of le Cirque, a New York theatrical troupe at a Diabetes fundraiser held in October of 1988. BERT EMANUELE  Fullscreen Buy Photo Owner Mike Ilitch's team includes his daughter Denise, the general counsel, his son in law, Jim Lites, the executive vice president, and his wife, Marian, secretary-treasurer. Picture taken in 1988 at the Joe. Patricia Beck  Mike Ilitch speaks about his acquisition of baseball's Detroit Tigers. John Luke  Fullscreen Buy Photo Mike and Marian Illitch with Sergei Fedorov in the lockerroom with the trophy they won for winning the Western Conference Finals in the fifth game against the Chicago Blackhawks at Joe Louis Arena in 1995. JULIAN H. GONZALEZ  Fullscreen Buy Photo STANLEY CUP--RED WINGS OWNER MIKE ILITCH hugs coach SCOTTY BOWMAN after their Stanley Cup win over the Flyers Saturday night at Joe Louis Arena in 1997. JULIAN H. GONZALEZ, DETROIT FREE PRESS Fullscreen Buy Photo In 2002, Wings coach Scotty Bowman hugs Mike Ilitch at end of game when they won the Stanley Cup. Julian H. Gonzalez  Fullscreen Buy Photo Detroit Red Wings owner Mike Ilitch gives the thumbs up to crowds during the Stanley Cup victory celebration at Hart Plaza in Detroit on June 6, 2008. AMY LEANG, DETROIT FREE PRESS Fullscreen Buy Photo Red Wings Owner Mike Ilitch watchs his Wings play Montreal near the end of the 1994 regular season. JULIAN H. GONZALEZ  Fullscreen Buy Photo In 2008, Mike and Marian Ilitch share a quiet moment along near the ice before they and the team gather for a team picture. ERIC SEALS  Fullscreen Buy Photo MIke Ilitch takes a look at Darren McCarty 40 stiches required to fix his face during a game in 1999. William Archie  Fullscreen Buy Photo Newest Detroit Red Wing BRETT HULL is handed his new jersey by Wings' owner MIKE ILITCH during the formal press conference when he was introduced in 2001. Julian H. Gonzalez  Fullscreen Buy Photo In 1997, Mike Ilitch shakes hands with the parade goers down Woodward Ave. after winning the Stanley Cup. Francisco Kjolseth, DETROIT FREE PRESS Fullscreen Buy Photo In 1998, Detroit Red Wings owner Mike Ilitch during the Detroit Red Wings Stanly Cup parade in Detroit. The Wings swept the Washington Capitals in 4 games. Gabriel B. Tait
